etymology.description: 词(word) + 汇(collection) = collection of words (vocabulary/lexicon).
etymology.interpretation: Means the stock or collection of words used in a language, field, or by a person. Common in linguistics, education, and lexicography.
etymology.simplification: 詞 → 词 simplifies the 言 radical to 讠 to reduce strokes; 彙 → 汇 merges with 匯 into a single simplified form, leveraging the idea of ‘gathering/converging’ and streamlining high‑frequency usage.

examples.chinese: 学习新词汇有助于提高阅读理解(學習新詞彙有助於提高閱讀理解)。
examples.pinyin: Xuéxí xīn cíhuì yǒu zhù yú tígāo yuèdú lǐjiě.
examples.english: Learning new vocabulary helps improve reading comprehension.
